title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Short interview with the chair. Questions about your professional practice and teaching philosophy. Interview process was easy, so long as you are passionate about your work. Very professional, and easy to connect with.
Interview Questions: What is your approach to teaching?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Virtual group interview with many different people on the committee then there is an in person interview. It was a VERY repetitive process. Yes, Montclair enrollment improved but their current staff not so much.
Interview Questions: What is your advising philosophy?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, and long process..but worth it! This was pre-covid. Applied and two weeks later got a phone call for interview. Then went to 3 in person interview with Chair and Faculty. Offer was accepted and it took about 4 weeks to get onboarded. But in most cases they will hire you part time during the onboarding process if warranted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Higher Education

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: this experience was pretty interesting felt judged with all the ambassadors that were there but when it was all said and done didn't feel like it was the right fit for me
Interview Questions: what do you do for fun how would you give a tour

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State (Little Falls, NJ) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process started with a phone screening with the Recruiter, then a group interview. The last step involved an Excel test, written questions, and creating and then presenting a PowerPoint deck to some members of the Hiring Committee. 

I have not heard back on a hiring decision. It has been almost a month since my in-person interview and almost  2 months since the phone screening.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge you faced at work and how you handled it.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy and streamlined experience. I previously worked there on a freelance basis, so there was a sense of familiarity that was helpful. Having a portfolio was important.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a difficult experience at work. How did you get through it?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled it, when I got there half of the people on search committee didn't even show up. The ones that were there looked like they'd rather be somewhere else.  Why bother interviewing people if you're just going to go through the motions.
Interview Questions: Standard questions; what are your strengths/weaknesses, where do you see yourself in five years.  No creativity by the interviewers at all.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Interviews for student affairs positions on campus can be long but the community makes sure that candidates don't feel overwhelmed with meeting so many people. The interview lasts about 5-6 hours.
Interview Questions: You can be expected to give a presentation based on a prompt from the search committee

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview, 2 in person interview. HR was very helpful in keeping me posted as the interview process progressed. Hiring manager was also great at keeping in touch with me.
Interview Questions: Mostly about experience with working with teams from different departments.

title: Area Supervisor of Equipment Checkout Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. It was very conversational which made the whole process a lot more enjoyable. The interviewers were very nice and the overall experience was pleasant.
Interview Questions: Q: What sets you apart from the other applicants?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Montclair State (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy, personal staff and recruiters who were timely and responsive and very knowledgeable about the role etc. Easy, personal staff and recruiters who were timely and responsive and very knowledgeable about the role etc.
Interview Questions: Easy, personal staff and recruiters who were timely and responsive and very knowledgeable about the role etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Montclair State in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Not too difficult, be prepared for group interview. I had about 10 team members asking questions all in one Zoom. But all the team members seem to be kind people
Interview Questions: If you were tasked with multiple things at once, how would you organize your tasks?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I interview with multiple other applicants at the same time. It felt more like a discussion than a job interview. The interviewer did a really great job of putting the applicants at ease. Then, two weeks later you would get a decision about hiring via email.
Interview Questions: Tell me about some of your previous experience(s) in higher education research.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. I did not have a problem with the process. As layered as it, it does prepare you for future interview offers. Never was nervous about it, it seemed to be very organized and more personable than more interviews I had.
Interview Questions: What type of person are you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: During my application to the graduate school I indicated I was interested in a graduate research assistantship and the program coordinator of the department I was applying to emailed me. I had an in person interview with around 5 faculty members. A few days later I received an offer.
Interview Questions: What is your research experirence?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview - 3 people from the search committee. Couldn't answer specific questions about the job. Hard to hear everyone. Overall not a great experience. Be prepared for all types of questions beyond basic phone intv.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Questions and about Technology use

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: The process took approximately three months. Did a lot of free volunteer hours before I was offered something .  The whole experience is based on who do you before you can get something.
Interview Questions: GPA. Previous career opportunities.

title: Student Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Montclair State in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation for a phone interview 3 months after the I applied for the position.  My on campus interview was 2 months later.   The phone interview started 15 minutes late and there was not enough time to fishing it properly.   The on campus interview also started late and the committee members were more interested in socializing with themselves than with me as the candidate.  The assistant director also arrived very late for the interview which allowed for almost no time to speak with the hiring manager.  It felt like no one at this institution had any clue what they were doing or had any respect for the candidate.  I would not accept an offer to work at this University due to the lack of professionalism shown to me by it's staff and Directors.
Interview Questions: How do you like to be managed?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: phone interview then in person. a committee made up of people that interact with  this position across campus.  usually from various departments. in person interview will be with committee as well as hiring major
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took less than 30 min, asking what motivates you and why you want the job. The lady was nice and polite and asked straightforward questions. Dress appropriately, be calm and show your true self.
Interview Questions: What motivates you and why?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview which was for the ADP department to serve as a graduate assistant. This was for graduate students only. The interview went well. However I didn’t take the graduate assistant position
Interview Questions: Why do you want the position

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty straight forward. There were two rounds of interviews. Be prepared to start a few months after the offer. Staff is friendly and approachable. Very diverse campus, in regards to both students and faculty. No phone interview, just two in person interviews.
Interview Questions: What are the challenges first generation students face?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple, I had an interview with a panel of professors that work in the department and they each took turns asking me basic interview questions. The department chair was also in the room asking questions. They each discussed their position and research interests, and then gave me the opportunity to ask them questions regarding their work.
Interview Questions: How do you handle workplace conflict?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two skype interviews, one with the history side of the department and another with the theory side.  The general emphasis was on teaching experience, grading policy, approach to the class, etc. I would also point out that the department controls how many sections each adjunct gets so as to maintain their ineligibility for health insurance.
Interview Questions: How would you teach this class?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by a former classmate at which point they asked me if I would like to join their team and help tutor undergraduates. I had some free time between classes and felt it would be a good learning experience so I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: "Do you want to be a tutor?"

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume online, got a phone interview first, then on-campus interview. The on-campus interview took 3 days. I was put in a crappy hotel. Peple were nice and the interview was not too hard.
Interview Questions: Why Montclair State? kind of cliche but it is definitely asked.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Being asked by the search committee that contains both staff from hiring department and faculty members from different areas. The questions are formal, which focused on the specific area you are applying for. It would be better for you to carefully go through your portfolio and your key skills and knowledge in your subject area before you attending the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: SDCL Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montclair State
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact was through a referral. I went in to meet with the Director. She asked me to set up a time to come in for an interview. We discussed a date and time via email. It was relatively painless. Met with panel from the department. They all asked questions. They were friendly. It was not daunting. They gave me the opportunity to ask questions as well. They were very professional.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an irate customer on the phone?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in and asked questions on administrative tasks and teaching. I met with a panel, then met the group, met with my supervisor, met with their supervisor... Everyone I met with was smart, nice, and friendly. Despite the panel interview, I felt confident in myself afterward.
Interview Questions: Who do you follow in the field of _______?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: they ask you to apply online. you apply, interview is short and questions your availability. it was'nt bad, but they try to match your interest up with a professor in your department
Interview Questions: What were my interest

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Montclair State in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the chair of the counseling department and they looked over my resume and mainly asked to know more about me, why I chose the college, if I had any questions for them, and they also explained the nature of the job.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to go into counseling?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montclair State in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Simple process to get enrolled for Graduate assistant-ship. Just check the check box in the application form for Masters.
Then , there was telephonic conversion verifying your information. This is also not done for all. Among the GAs , only I was given an telephonic interview
Interview Questions:
1.They were concerned more about my past GPA, since I have 3.85 GPA, it was easy to clear the interview
2. Work experience is also given high priority, especially related to the Masters program you selected.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: mentioned interest on graduate school application. was contacted if still interested. interview date and time was arranged. interviewed by several faculty from department. was informed of hiring a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: what are some relevant skills you have?

title: Procurement Administrator/Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montclair State (Clifton, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was very informative and laid back. I made it to my interview on time. As I met each one of my interviewers, they wanted know more about me as a person then what I did at first. After that, the interview started with me talking about my resume. A dialogue of questions and my responses took place and after that, I was able to ask them questions. After the interview, I thanked them both for their time and the opportunity in meeting them. Before I could get back home, the headhunter called me back with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Years of experience doing procurement.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process for the Graduate Assistant position. It was based upon performance during the student's time in undergraduate. I applied for the GA position and the coordinator looked at my experiences, GPA, and extracurricular activities in order to decide whether or not I was potentially a good fit for the company.
Interview Questions: No specific questions were asked.

title: Assistant Director, Cooperative Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montclair State (Upper Montclair, NJ)
Interview Descriptions:
Totally unprofessional interview process.

I was called to interview as an assistant director of cooperative education position; the search committee chairwoman, a biology professor, indicated in the e-mail that there were eight faculty members on the committee, so bring enough copies of your handout. She also said I would be meeting with the Dean of the school, after the interview with the search committee.

So I arrived the usual ten minutes early. Fifteen minutes after the scheduled start time, the secretary escorted me to a conference room down the hall. The committee chairwoman was there, and two other professors. The chairwoman said I would not be meeting with the Dean afterwards. Okay.  

They asked me to give the presentation first, so I did that. The director of the career center arrived ten minutes later, after the interview had started.  After I finished the presentation a couple of the faculty members asked me a question. The others just sat there in silence. The chair asked me if I had any questions, so I asked a few, and they gave their answers.  I smiled and tried to engage with them, but these folks were clearly just going through the motions. Then they thanked me and I left. 

I never heard back from them, not even an e-mail stating they had selected a final candidate. I found out months later they gave the job to someone who was already working in another office on campus.  I don’t think there’s anything wrong with that. What’s wrong is wasting the time of the other candidates who had no chance of being hired.
Interview Questions: They were just stock questions, nothing unexpected. They weren't very creative or imaginative questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted via website.  Phone interview followed by in person interview.  The in person interview was with the person I was to work for and lasted approximately 1 hour.  I felt the questions were reasonable and appropriate for the position and the information presented has been accurate now that I have the job.
Interview Questions: What attracts you to higher ed?

title: Director, Learning and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
It was great for me.  I interviewed by phone with the recruiter.  She brought me in to meet her, the hiring manager, three colleagues, and the VP of the department.  The first part of the processes went very quickly and no horrible application to fill out.  I just sent in my resume!  Very professional.  If you deal with the recruiting director then you will have a good experience.  I interviewed with many companies and she was the most professional out of all of them!

One con was the waiting after the offer.  They have to submit all offers to the board and you have to wait until that goes through.  The other con was that I had to wait two months for health insurance.
Interview Questions: One person asked about working with a challenging project and to describe my experience.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair Heights, NJ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was called to interview as an assistant director of cooperative education position; the search committee chairwoman, a biology professor, indicated in the e-mail that there were eight faculty members on the committee, so bring enough copies of your handout. She also said I would be meeting with the Dean of the school, after the interview with the search committee.

So I arrived the usual ten minutes early. Fifteen minutes after the scheduled start time, the secretary escorted me to a conference room down the hall. The committee chairwoman was there, and two other professors. The chairwoman said I would not be meeting with the Dean afterwards. Okay.

They asked me to give the presentation first, so I did that. The director of the career center arrived ten minutes later, after the interview had started. After I finished the presentation a couple of the faculty members asked me a question. The others just sat there in silence. The chair asked me if I had any questions, so I asked a few, and they gave their answers. I smiled and tried to engage with them, but these folks were clearly just going through the motions. Then they thanked me and I left.

I never heard back from them, not even an e-mail stating they had selected a final candidate. I found out months later they gave the job to someone who was already working in another office on campus. I don’t think there’s anything wrong with that. What’s wrong is wasting the time of the other candidates who had no chance of being hired.

The interview questions were just stock questions, nothing unexpected. They weren’t very creative or imaginative questions.
Interview Questions: previous experience

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: After applying to Montclair State University's costume shop through a career fair, I received an email scheduling the interview. The employer was very helpful and flexible, letting me choose a time of my liking. I actually went in for the interview the same day I received the email and was greeted with surprise and a friendly atmosphere. My employer asked a few questions and went on to give me a small test to see how well I was able to learn and follow directions. Afterwards, we discussed aspects of the job such as what would be required of me and what I would be doing.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in sewing?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked me to described my previous lecture experiences, and how I would address different potential scenarios I might face as a professor. She also explained a lot about MSU and the student and campus culture. The interview was very relaxed and conversational.  hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: How would you make sure your students stay engaged throughout he semester?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Montclair State (Montclair, NJ) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Research presentation, interviews with search committee, dept, chair, college dean and students.
Interview Questions: Research agenda
